Eric Pugh <epugh@...> writes:

> I sort had felt that the Nutch project was fairly inactive...

Nutch had been inactive for quite a while, but then there was a flurry
of activity in December 2008 and then here and there the first 4 months
of this year.

NutchWAX 0.12 has been undergoing renewed development since the start of
2008 with 3 releases last year and another slated to come out in the
next month.

> And I like the Solr/Heretrix approach of separating the responsibility
> for Crawling from the responsibility of Searching...

So do I, which is what we do in NutchWAX.  The NutchWAX 'import' command
reads archived pages from (W)ARC files, producing a Nutch segment.  We
subvert the crawling features of Nutch and import the content directly.

> I am looking at some of the nutchwax code to see how to parse ARC
> records and pull out content.

NutchWAX uses the "commons" library bundled with Heritrix, where the
code for (W)ARC file reading is found.  If you want just that piece, it
might be easier to get it from Heritrix rather than NutchWAX.


Aaron

-- 
Aaron Binns
Senior Software Engineer, Web Group
Internet Archive
